title: The Most Ingenious Signs From the Climate Strike Protests
text:
Photo: Nicolas Koutsokostas/NurPhoto via Getty Images

Of all the marches and protests since 2016, was there ever any question that the signs at the Global Climate Strike would be the most innovative and witty yet? Gen Z has a knack for incorporating its politics into its internet-inflected, ironic, and earnest self-expression so uncannily, so it’s to be expected that its IRL signs would be as funny, charming, and devastating as the best “climemes.”

They did not disappoint, and American strikes haven’t even taken place yet (see you in New York). All around the world, protesters made fun of olds, they lamented missing today’s raid on Area 51, they ask if “David Attenbruh” would be their dad. It was another antidote to the insanity of this week’s utterly embarrassing showing on Capitol Hill by climate-science-denying Republicans, who made teens, including hero Greta Thunberg, answer questions like, “Why should we believe the science?”

In the words of one of the signs below, “We’ll be less activist if you be less shit.”

who made this it is MAGNIFICENT pic.twitter.com/s2KsXqgLdb — Bella Mackie (@bellamackie) September 20, 2019

Never mind THIS is the best #ClimateStrike sign. 😂 pic.twitter.com/1KwiI3pcW5 — Jordan Meehan 🏳️‍🌈 (@JordanMeehan) September 20, 2019

Photo: Ulrich Baumgarten/U. Baumgarten via Getty Images

Photo: Nicolas Koutsokostas/NurPhoto via Getty Images

Hot Earth Summer! This is the best sign so far at Los Angeles Climate Strike. Zeina Hassan, 16, wants to pursue environmental studies in college and is here today because she doesn’t want to live in a world that she can’t even recognize pic.twitter.com/j0JQYNmf6c — Sonali Kohli 🙆🏾 (@Sonali_Kohli) September 20, 2019

Photo: Ezra Acayan/Getty Images

is my sign too niche?#ClimateStrike 12pm custom house quay 🌎 pic.twitter.com/83gxZRrtAp — Rosa Nutty (@RosaNutty) September 20, 2019

this one is sick pic.twitter.com/AareFHYmni — henno (@jrhennessy) September 20, 2019

This may be my favourite #ClimateStrike sign from Sydney. pic.twitter.com/Hds507rDOF — Mikey Nicholson (@Mikey_Nicholson) September 20, 2019

Favorite sign so far at London #climatestrike: Less Boris More Forests pic.twitter.com/je50b27kUn — Sarah Jaffe (@sarahljaffe) September 20, 2019

Photo: Dan Kitwood/Getty Images

Excellent sign game at the Sydney #ClimateStrike march pic.twitter.com/YXwgGxjGvY — Kate Lyons (@MsKateLyons) September 20, 2019

Some Sydney #ClimateStrike signs!



"Kinda thought my death would be cooler than this." pic.twitter.com/6eCdlBYDZJ — Mehreen Faruqi (@MehreenFaruqi) September 20, 2019

Photo: Gareth Fuller - PA Images/PA Images via Getty Images

Photo: picture alliance/dpa/picture alliance via Getty I

These are my favourite Sydney #climatestrike signs from today pic.twitter.com/PJM2oYWVta — Josh Butler (@JoshButler) September 20, 2019

my last minute sign for the global #ClimateStrike happening tomorrow in melbourne 💚 pic.twitter.com/y3LZA9Kwa1 — andrea (@asapsmoki) September 19, 2019

These signs at the Sydney #climatestrike are a mood pic.twitter.com/x1Gu4JpWQW — LunoVox (@LunoVox) September 20, 2019

Photo: Gareth Fuller/PA Images via Getty Images
description: As the Global Climate Strike and school walkout get underway, these are the best, funniest, and smartest protests signs from the very witty Gen-Z teens who took to the streets.
